definition: to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: So you would probably not want to put them together.
sentences.chinese: 因此你可能不想将他们放一起套作。

sentences.english: I've decided to use interplanting in this field.
sentences.chinese: 我决定试着在这块田地里套作两种蔬菜。

sentences.english: The density of cropping corn should be reasonably increased, compared to the monocropping corn.
sentences.chinese: 与单作相比，套作玉米应适当增加植株密度。

sentences.english: With reproductive process, the nutrients concentration of the organ in both cotton intercropping and cotton alone gradually decline.
sentences.chinese: 随生育进程，单套作棉各器官中养分浓度逐渐下降。

definition: rotation of crops (to preserve fertility of soil)
genre of writing/literary form/style/literary recreation and sporting activities
applied writing/writing for practical purposes (business letters, advertising etc)
to get off the main topic/to digress
to digress/to stray from the subject
